sentences.sContent: We sneaked out while Jessie’s mom wasn’t looking.
sentences.sCn: 我们趁杰茜的妈妈没有看到，偷偷地溜了出去。

sentences.sContent: If you look carefully you can see that the painting represents a human figure.
sentences.sCn: 如果仔细看，就会看出画上是一个人形。

sentences.sContent: Gina covered her eyes, afraid to look.
Let me have a look at that – I think it’s mine.
sentences.sCn: 让我看一下那个东西——我想它是我的。

sentences.sContent: ...let’s go look at this space on Queen Anne...
...have a clear strategy for dealing with angry owners—they look away...
...I look forward to each day and experiencing something new...
...And that the characteristics adult children look for when they begin the search are not necessarily the things that make a difference to the people who are going to move in...
...Families can look a bit more for where the residents are going to be happy...
...They will look for evidence that you have reflected and thought about the subject...
...the mountains look as if you could just reach out and touch them.M: That’s why I chose this lodge...
...We can look at and learn from Steve Jobs what the essence of American innovation is...

synos.tran: 看；期待；注意；面向；看上去像

phrases.pCn: 游览；到处察看；到处寻找
俯视；向下看；用目光慑服某人；[股]看跌

words.tran: 检查员；观看者；美人（口语）

trans.tranOther: to turn your eyes towards something, so that you can see it
an act of looking at something
